comments.body: @liggitt as you can see, throughout this psp externalization, we are putting all the conversion logic (which i think we have to do) into the constructor function of each strategy. so now, we list/watch external psp objects in admission controller, and do internal conversion when instantiating strategies (so that we neednt do conversion everytime we actually call strategy), finally the psp provider interface will accept internal pod/container and return internal types back to admission controllers. this will be how externalized psp works. wdyt?

> do internal conversion when instantiating strategies (so that we neednt do conversion everytime we actually call strategy)

strategies are instantiated every time a pod is admitted. doing conversions as part of their construction is not ideal.

> the psp provider interface will accept internal pod/container and return internal types back to admission controllers

that part is fine
